text: the eruption of a volcano can be one of
the planet's most destructive events
spewing huge amounts of rock gas and ash
that can kill people
cause crops to fail disrupt air travel
and even alter the weather but not all
eruptions are cataclysmic some are a lot
quieter and far less deadly there are
many types of volcanoes but all are
cracks in the earth with a chamber of
molten rock or magma underneath the hot
magma is lighter than the surrounding
rock so it rises as it does gas bubbles
form increasing pressure the magma
starts to flow taking the path of least
resistance once the magma reaches the
surface it's called lava if the lava is
thin the gases will bubble out easily
and the lava will flow quietly but if
the lava is thick the gases will cause
it to erupt explosively creating
boulders cinders and ash some volcanoes
have a collapsed central section called
a caldera that can act like a plug as
the magma flows elsewhere the caldera
may sink until it cracks in the magma
has a new path to the surface then the
volcano can literally blow its top
you
Oh
